title: Better than Anticipated
text: Ham Luong Hotel Review - 02-06-14 Dates of Stay 01-31-14 to 02-06-14 Hotel (200C Hung Vuong, T.P. Ben Tre,  ) GPS coordinates: N10º 14 044, E106º 22 138 The hotel is located about a half mile west of Quoc lo 60 street on Hung Vuong street. Cho Ben Tre is at the corner of Hung Vuong and Quoc lo 60. The hotel faces the Ben Tre River (Song Ben Tre). Checking In As I had booked the room directly, with price agreed to earlier, there were no formalities when we arrived. Our bags were taken directly to the room. All that was required was our passports, which in Vietnam is pretty much guaranteed payment. The Agoda.com price was the same as the hotels direct rate almost to the dollar. But as we booked direct, the hotel later gave us one night free for a six-day stay. Room We stayed in room 301, which I should have known was one previously reviewed and criticized for the noise coming from the bar area directly above. Second floor rooms are probably far better insulated from the noise I’m sure. I first heard the chair shuffling from above when I was soaking in the tub around 5:30 PM. Would it continue for long and how long? The room labeled a suite, is quite large. It was one of the largest that I’ve stayed in SEA for the price paid. Then again, this isn’t Sai Gon, Ha Noi, or some beach fancy beach resort. It’s the Delta. Flooring in the room was all tile, very clean and cool. I don’t mind walking barefoot on tile floors but not carpeting, even though the the hotel supplied sandals. Lighting in the room was typically dim. I’m all for any energy-saving devices and fixtures but some areas of a room or bathroom require brighter lighting. So the lighting in this particular room was not bright enough for me. This particular room had an upright refrigerator with internal freezer compartment and was of sufficient space to store perhaps 35-50 12 oz. cans of beverages or a combination of food and drink. It wasn’t running when we opened the room (to save power), so I had to turn it up to its maximum setting to make it chill down quick for beverage and food storage. Because I suspected it had not been running for awhile it had a slight odor (musty). I wasn’t worried as I was only storing cans for now. After about five hours, my beverages were near freezing, perfect if the weather turns really hot. So far, the weather has been quite mild. (Oh dear! Acoustic guitar and singing just started above our room at 7:50 PM!) I would certainly avoid rooms on the third floor (especially room 301) if you cannot handle loud music and chairs being dragged across the tile floor above you. The sound literally echoes through the room and lasts well past 10 PM, when staff are still moving chairs probably back to their original placement. How would one describe the outfitting of the room, late government provincial? The suite has a fair amount of furniture, which looks like most other furniture in Vietnam. It’s that dark-stained wood with 27 coats of varnish. With all the protection, I’m sure it is resilient as floor tiles and concrete. SEA is not kind on buildings. The warm or hot, humid weather is a perfect catalyst for mold, mildew, and rot. So the beautiful set of wooden chairs in the room are hard as a rock and not inviting for a long sit-down. Everything is cement, tile, more tile, heavily varnished wood. The TV is still the old fashion, one hundred pound monstrosity. Quite frankly, I haven’t seen one in SEA for years. I thought everything was flat screens by now. Our room had a king size bed with a high density foam mattress. It was quite firm but wasn’t like sleeping on a concrete slab. At least there were no springs pushing against one’s body at night. The room also has an electric water cooker for making coffee or tea. Free tea was available but we took the Vietnamese coffee with condensed milk down at the restaurant with breakfast. The room also has a blow dryer for one’s hair. (I don’t have enough to dry.) Speaking of TV, there will be dozens of Vietnamese and Chinese stations. I did manage to find five English channels, including Cinemax, HBO, Animal Planet, National Geographic, and Discovery Channel, which is not bad for a hotel in a rural town. The WiFi is good throughout the building from what I can see. The network is not protected (it’s open) so protect your computer as best you can (turn on computer firewall and don’t allow file sharing for starters). Bandwidth was adequate enough to support several quality Facetime sessions (video-conferencing). Facebook not locked out at this hotel, so enjoy. A dysfunctional rooster next door started crowing around 3 - 3:30 AM daily. Breakfast Breakfast turned out to be much better than I had anticipated. Most mornings, we arrived between 7 - 7:30 AM. The number of foods offered were quite varied. Bowls of Udon soup with various meats, vegetables had been prepared in advance. This was the first day and morning’s menu changed daily (see below). They were all excellent! All one had to do was ladle some broth into the bowl and eat. Here’s a list of items we encountered for the breakfast buffet during our six-day stay: Udon noodle soup (Banh Canh) Pho - Bun Bo Hue Bun Moc (noodle soup) with pork or pork ball Chau ca - (Congee with Thac Lac fish) Congee with duck egg Chau (Congee - plain) Congee with oyster mushrooms (my favorite) Congee with yellow squash Bo Kho (beef stew) Sui Mai (pork) braised in a tomato type base (Different soups, congees and other foods not served everyday) Sliced bread Baguette bread pieces Fried eggs Mini egg omelets Fried, small chicken pieces Stir fried rice Stir fried rice with seafood Stir fried rice with crab Stir fried noodles Stir fried greens (sort of a spinach) Stir fried cabbage Stir fried mustard greens Stir fried bokchoy Shrimp dumplings Glutinous rice cakes Hot dog (sausages shape like nuggets) Pork roll slices Sliced tomatoes Sliced cucumbers Condiments of various sorts Jams Jellies Butter Vietnamese coffee with condensed milk Hot water Tea Passion fruit juice (diluted) Fresh watermelon slices Fresh dragon fruit slicesFresh pineapple slices Again, foods above appeared on different days. One kind of soup daily along with one congee (plain) and one other congee with another ingredient like seafood, mushroom, squash or something else. If you must get your salt, try placing a couple pieces of salted egg in your soup or congee. It’s delicious! (Take the sliver of shell off the egg before dumping it in you soup.) Bath The first impression that I got with the bath was that it was spacious, white, all tiled floor to ceiling, and most important, clean. The tub was large and had a built-in jacuzzi. After a long twenty-four hours of transpacific travel, including a two hour layover in Hong Kong, I decided on a hot soaking. I turned on the hot water to fill the tub but after accumulating about three inches of water, the delivery system had turned cold. Alas, my share of the hot water had been exhausted from the over the sink electric hot water heater. Make sure the switch on the wall is turned on. When the hot water is used up, the heater starts heating up another batch. It’s certainly enough to take a nice hot shower of five to seven or eight minutes. Sufficiently relaxed and wet, I decided it was time to towel down and have a cool beverage. I turned the handle to open the drain but the mechanical bath stopper would not rise to drain the water. Heck with it for now. Later called the front desk, who sent up a person directly to fix it within five minutes. There was no separate shower stall. The tub itself has one of those long stainless steel hoses with shower handle on the end. It’s mounted at around five feet, so one stands under it or pulls the device off the wall and uses it manually or stationary if you’re short. The only problem is that a large amount of water falls outside the tub and lands on the tile floor, which in the scope of things isn’t all that bad either. Vietnamese bathroom floors are laid on a slope to route the water to a drain in the corner of the room. Floor tiles dry quickly in the warm weather. The bath towels were in very good condition if not nearly new, soft and fresh smelling. Pool There is a small pool on the side and toward the back of the hotel. It’s pretty well shaded by the hotel and adjoining buildings. The water water felt cool but I am sure it would be inviting. The tiles near the pool’s coping looked like they needed a good scrubbing as algae was staring to appear. Cafe/Bar There is a cafe/bar on the fourth floor that faces the river. It’s fairly large taking up the entire width of the hotel. Good breezes under a covered patio-like structure. Offers beverages of all sorts and ice creams. Sai Gon Red was 18,000d, 333 was 21,000d, mixed drinks 50,000d and up., etc. On our last day, we noticed they gave us one night free for staying six, an added surprise. Pros Price - Good value for what you get Clean - Can’t fault the room and bath cleanliness, at least for room 301 Spacious - More than adequate room size for price Location - Facing the river and about a half mile west of the central market, Cho Ben Tre. Easy 10-minute walk along the river Breakfast - More than adequate inclusive breakfast. Sorry westerners, no Whoppers or Big Macs here. Strong A/C in the room A fruit plate every night Cons Noisy cafe/bar above third floor rooms. The cacophony doesn’t subside until after 10 PM. If you only speak English, having a conversation will be frustrating at times. Low wattage lighting in the room, especially nightstands by bed, too weak to read at night. Cafe/Bar staff could be more attentive. As a westerner and hotel resident, I wasn’t served promptly, as those coming off the street, which was quite irritating. ============================================================== Between My Tho and Ben Tre, this is was the fourth hotel sampled and arguably the best stay in this area during the last 10 years.
hotelName: Khách sạn Du lịch Hàm Luông
en_review: Ham Luong Hotel Review - 02-06-14 Dates of Stay 01-31-14 to 02-06-14 Hotel (200C Hung Vuong, T.P. Ben Tre,  ) GPS coordinates: N10º 14 044, E106º 22 138 The hotel is located about a half mile west of Quoc lo 60 street on Hung Vuong street. Cho Ben Tre is at the corner of Hung Vuong and Quoc lo 60. The hotel faces the Ben Tre River (Song Ben Tre). Checking In As I had booked the room directly, with price agreed to earlier, there were no formalities when we arrived. Our bags were taken directly to the room. All that was required was our passports, which in Vietnam is pretty much guaranteed payment. The Agoda.com price was the same as the hotels direct rate almost to the dollar. But as we booked direct, the hotel later gave us one night free for a six-day stay. Room We stayed in room 301, which I should have known was one previously reviewed and criticized for the noise coming from the bar area directly above. Second floor rooms are probably far better insulated from the noise I’m sure. I first heard the chair shuffling from above when I was soaking in the tub around 5:30 PM. Would it continue for long and how long? The room labeled a suite, is quite large. It was one of the largest that I’ve stayed in SEA for the price paid. Then again, this isn’t Sai Gon, Ha Noi, or some beach fancy beach resort. It’s the Delta. Flooring in the room was all tile, very clean and cool. I don’t mind walking barefoot on tile floors but not carpeting, even though the the hotel supplied sandals. Lighting in the room was typically dim. I’m all for any energy-saving devices and fixtures but some areas of a room or bathroom require brighter lighting. So the lighting in this particular room was not bright enough for me. This particular room had an upright refrigerator with internal freezer compartment and was of sufficient space to store perhaps 35-50 12 oz. cans of beverages or a combination of food and drink. It wasn’t running when we opened the room (to save power), so I had to turn it up to its maximum setting to make it chill down quick for beverage and food storage. Because I suspected it had not been running for awhile it had a slight odor (musty). I wasn’t worried as I was only storing cans for now. After about five hours, my beverages were near freezing, perfect if the weather turns really hot. So far, the weather has been quite mild. (Oh dear! Acoustic guitar and singing just started above our room at 7:50 PM!) I would certainly avoid rooms on the third floor (especially room 301) if you cannot handle loud music and chairs being dragged across the tile floor above you. The sound literally echoes through the room and lasts well past 10 PM, when staff are still moving chairs probably back to their original placement. How would one describe the outfitting of the room, late government provincial? The suite has a fair amount of furniture, which looks like most other furniture in Vietnam. It’s that dark-stained wood with 27 coats of varnish. With all the protection, I’m sure it is resilient as floor tiles and concrete. SEA is not kind on buildings. The warm or hot, humid weather is a perfect catalyst for mold, mildew, and rot. So the beautiful set of wooden chairs in the room are hard as a rock and not inviting for a long sit-down. title: 推荐
text: 环境相当好，适合家庭旅行，私密性很好，沙滩也是独家享用的，服务和餐饮也很不错，值得下次再来，会推荐朋友来。
hotelName: Meliá Vinpearl Cam Ranh Beach Resort
en_review: 环境相当好，适合家庭旅行，私密性很好，沙滩也是独家享用的，服务和餐饮也很不错，值得下次再来，会推荐朋友来。

title: Traumurlaub
text: Wir sind jetzt 3 Tage hier und bleiben noch weitere 10 Tage. Diese Anlage ist einfach nur traumhaft. Strand, Hotellage, Zimmer, Service und Essen sind wirklich super. Das Personal ist sehr freundlich und zuvorkommend. Meine kleinen Verbesserungsvorschläge: Das Hotel sollte einen Mopedverleih vor Ort organisieren. Es ist nervig nach Nha Trang zu fahren und einen Verleih zu suchen. Am Abend sollte es in der Saigon-Bar eine Happyhour geben (z.B. 21.00-22.00). Dann wären sicher ein paar Gäste mehr da, um die Livemusik zu genießen. Liebe Grüße von Zimmer 5321.

title: Bad experience in Dong Van
text: Our stay at Huyen Tram Guesthouse began badly as when we arrived our rooms,booked through Booking.com were not available. We had altered our booking to arrive a day later than planned and received confirmation from Booking.com but "reception" just a man with a mobile phone claimed ignorance. He did manage to find a room that we had to share but came up later to ask for more money. My daughter speaks Vietnamese but not enough to argue with him. He was back again early morning banging on the door, presumably to make sure we hadn't left without paying! The place is very basic with few amenities. Only plus, the beds were comfortable.

title: Acceptable
text: Not to bad for a nite stay. Rooms basic. Hot shower good and room heating acceptable. We had rooms to the back with beautiful view of the city and the lake. We had the hotpot dinner at the hotel and it was delicious. Staff helpful. Location is good. Just a walking distance to the free cultural show from local tribes only on Saturday at the Night Market.

We had the hotpot dinner at the hotel and it was delicious. Staff helpful. Location is good. Just a walking distance to the free cultural show from local tribes only on Saturday at the Night Market.

title: „Service super! Ansonsten OK!“
text: Wir sind morgens um 4:30 angekommen und konnten direkt einschicken. Haben sogar noch einen Kaffee bekommen. Die Nacht wurde auch nicht berechnet. Die Zimmer sind sehr einfach ausgestattet. Betten noch grad so OK. Haben uns auch ein Moped ausgeliehen und mussten Tanken. Haben für 100.000 VDN getankt und nachher sogar 50000 zurück bekommen, weil wir soviel nicht verfahren haben. Frühstück das typische Brot mit Omlett und Kaffee inkl. Wer Wert auf guten Service legt und dem die Zimmer nicht so wichtig sind, kann hier gut ein zwei Tage übernachten.

title: Thất vọng
text: Chúng tôi cùng lớp của con đi lien hoan cuối năm tại đây tuần vừa rồi (11 & 12/6). Mặc dù dịch vụ bể bơi đã được tính vào giá trọn gói khi sử dụng phòng nhưng nhân viên lễ tân trực (lúc 10h30 sáng 12/6) nhất quyết đòi các cháu phải trả tiền vé bơi mới được vào. Cung cách phụ vụ giống thời mậu dịch, nhân viên không chuyên nghiệp. bể bơi rất nhỏ và đông, phòng ở rất bình thường. Tôi không có ý định quay lại nơi này.̀

title: Great for a getaway but did feel like something was missing?
text: We stayed for three nights and had a great time, despite the wet and cold weather. The rooms are great, with lots of character and the beds were very comfortable. Though I found the standard pillows far to uncomfortable as they were so big! The pillow menu is definitely needed. The bathrooms were great, nice and spacious with a huge standalone tub. However, when we used it we realised that the plug didn't seal properly and the water had to constantly be refilled. The grounds and gardens are nice but could do with a bit more attention and the communal areas of the villa's looked a little ignored. Breakfast was good and with the exception of our first nights order, all the food we ate at the restaurant was good if a little overpriced for what you get. It was actually the best food we ate in Dalat, which seems to be the hardest place we've been to in Vietnam to find a good meal - not a single restaurant we visited (with the exception of Oron and the Ana Mandara's), we'd wish to visit again simply as the food was the worst we've had in Vietnam. The Ana Mandara staff were great and really helpful when needed, but overall I felt something was missing considering the prices you pay. Perhaps it's the slightly old and run down feel to some communal areas and sections of the grounds? The pool was nice, heated which was needed but the pool bar was definitely lacking attention and the kids room was pretty poor - and freezing. The cushions on the sunbeds were also a little moldy and often wet when we came to use them. The spa definitely lived up to it's reputation - both our massages were extremely professional and one of the best we've had in Asia. Overall it was a good stay, the staff are great and the rooms have a lot of atmosphere.

The spa definitely lived up to it's reputation - both our massages were extremely professional and one of the best we've had in Asia. Overall it was a good stay, the staff are great and the rooms have a lot of atmosphere.

title: A stylish and relaxing retreat in the uncommercial south of Vietnam
text: We arrived at the Alma Oasis after a few hectic days in Ho Chi Minh. The hotel is a series of low rise bungalows spread throughout well maintained tropical gardens with beautiful views sweeping down to the ocean. The beach was deserted for our entire stay despite this being New Year, and if the enormous pool had another couple or two sitting around it, that was a busy day. It was like having the entire resort to ourselves (naturally, we loved it!) The staff were so welcoming and friendly from the first day. Most speak some English and nothing was ever too much trouble. The GM Karmen ran a very tight ship, she was highly visible every day, making sure everything was running smoothly. The highlight for me was the spa, run by Balinese manager Yoman. We didn't realise when booking that we were entitled to have a different massage EVERY day, included in the room rate. What a treat. I have travelled extensively throughout SE Asia and the tiny female therapists and masseuses were among the very best I have experienced anywhere. They literally climb onto the treatment bed to bear down on you with their weight. You can choose from aromatherapy, bamboo, Thai tiger, hot and cold stone massages and each was a revelation. I have never returned from a holiday feeling as relaxed and stress free. The spa also offers three shots a day of immunity boosting, detoxifying, digestive aiding nutrients...apple cider vinegar and honey or turmeric, lemon juice and ginger amongst others...which you take before each meal. What a revelation. I felt amazing, so much so that I'm endeavouring to continue the good work now that I'm home. The food at the My Oasis restaurant is Vietnamese cuisine at its very best; light, fresh with that zingy combination of spicy, sweet, hot and sour that Vietnam does so well. The Long Hai steamed clams were the best I've ever tasted (and spaghetti alle vongole is my favourite dish so I know my clams.) And the NYE barbecue was a delicious feast of fresh seafood, barbecued meats, light salads, pasta dishes and noodles which tempted all of us to eat way more than was strictly necessary. There isn't much outside the hotel grounds, just a little fishing village and a market, and we felt the nearest big town Vung Tau was not that special so if you are looking for lots to do in terms of visits and excursions, you might need to look elsewhere (although development is afoot almost everywhere you look, it remains unspoiled for now.) But as a New Year retreat with great friends who just want to start their day with Tai Chi and a massage before a dip in the sea and a snooze by the pool, it's hard to beat. On our last day just before departing, the staff came to find us to say goodbye and thank us individually at the end of their shifts. That's special.

What a revelation. I felt amazing, so much so that I'm endeavouring to continue the good work now that I'm home. The food at the My Oasis restaurant is Vietnamese cuisine at its very best; light, fresh with that zingy combination of spicy, sweet, hot and sour that Vietnam does so well. The Long Hai steamed clams were the best I've ever tasted (and spaghetti alle vongole is my favourite dish so I know my clams.) And the NYE barbecue was a delicious feast of fresh seafood, barbecued meats, light salads, pasta dishes and noodles which tempted all of us to eat way more than was strictly necessary. There isn't much outside the hotel grounds, just a little fishing village and a market, and we felt the nearest big town Vung Tau was not that special so if you are looking for lots to do in terms of visits and excursions, you might need to look elsewhere (although development is afoot almost everywhere you look, it remains unspoiled for now.) But as a New Year retreat with great friends who just want to start their day with Tai Chi and a massage before a dip in the sea and a snooze by the pool, it's hard to beat. On our last day just before departing, the staff came to find us to say goodbye and thank us individually at the end of their shifts. That's special.

title: Cherchez les étoiles !
text: Un hôtel 4 étoiles pas digne de ce nom. Nous avons nettement mieux avec moins d’étoiles. Chambre pas propre, de la nourriture sur le parquet, lavabo cassé, moisissure, meuble dégradé, etc… A fuir. Voir photos
hotelName: Muong Thanh Luxury Lang Son Hotel
en_review: Un hôtel 4 étoiles pas digne de ce nom. Nous avons nettement mieux avec moins d’étoiles. Chambre pas propre, de la nourriture sur le parquet, lavabo cassé, moisissure, meuble dégradé, etc… A fuir. Voir photos

title: Vorsicht Flöhe!!
text: Das Hotel befindet sich in einer wirklich schönen Umgebung mit einem tollen Strand. Leider sind die Hygiene und die Sauberkeit mangelhaft. Seit dem Aufenthalt dort, haben wir und Mitreisende Probleme mit einem Sandflohbefall. Auch die sanitären Anlagen waren leider eher ungenügend.
en_review: Das Hotel befindet sich in einer wirklich schönen Umgebung mit einem tollen Strand. Leider sind die Hygiene und die Sauberkeit mangelhaft. Seit dem Aufenthalt dort, haben wir und Mitreisende Probleme mit einem Sandflohbefall. Auch die sanitären Anlagen waren leider eher ungenügend.

title: Good, could easily be better.
text: We didn't get the hype around this place. The room was good but not great. The food average. Acknowledging that it's a matter of personal taste, the loud, live western music played in the lounge area somewhat disturbed the natural peace of the location. If we wanted a lively and buzzing atmosphere instead of the sounds of nature we would have stayed in one of the many hotels located in the town. We also witnessed one of the senior staff chastise another member of his staff while she was serving us, and we saw a rat under the adjacent table at dinner. The hotel does offer all the tours you'd expect and has free bikes on which you can explore the area. This hotel ticks the box of offering a base from which to explore Phong Nha, but there are a few areas to improve upon.

title: Ongezellige kamers
text: Van de 9 hotels waar we verbleven tijdens onze rondreis in Vietnam was dit qua kamers de grootste teleurstelling. We hadden ernaar uitgekeken in 'farmroom" te overnachten maar we verbleven in ongezellige bungalows met felle verlichting. Badkamer nodigde niet uit om te douchen. Deze van onze kinderen was niet proper nl. dode insecten op tegelranden. Poetsvrouw is deze wel dadelijk komen verwijderen op onze vraag. Vuil douchematje dat we zijn gaan omruilen aan receptie. Vonden dit zeer vervelend omdat we niet de gewoonte hebben te reclameren en ons hierdoor ongemakkelijk voelden. Matras die lawaai maakte bij elke beweging. Wat vooral ontbrak aan ontbijt was brood. Er was enkel toast die je moest opwarmen in verouderde toaster met timer en waar iedereen stond aan te schuiven. Niet echt ontspannend. Restaurant was oké. Simpel maar lekker gegeten. Lekkere cocktails gedronken aan gezellige poolbar. Wat veel goed maakte aan ons verblijf was het zeer vriendelijke personeel. Vlotte bediening.

title: Best place to stay!
text: I really liked the style of the guesthouse. Everything is clean, the rooms are super nice and the food is just amazing. The owner Maxime and his staff are just fantastic and I felt very welcome. Had lots of fun with all of them. And they try to help you in whatever it is. They even escort you to the bus at 4am in the morning to get sure you'll take the right one. I definitively would go back to the shack. I felt like home and best place to catch up other travelers. Thank you all for taking care of me.

The owner Maxime and his staff are just fantastic and I felt very welcome. Had lots of fun with all of them. And they try to help you in whatever it is. They even escort you to the bus at 4am in the morning to get sure you'll take the right one. I definitively would go back to the shack. I felt like home and best place to catch up other travelers. Thank you all for taking care of me.

title: Short vacation in Vinpearl Discovery 3 Phu Quoc
text: Room is clean and comfortable, customer service is good. Electric car is servered quickly, not too much wait. Buffet menu is not interested. Restaurant should add sea food and some special disk to menu.
en_review: Room is clean and comfortable, customer service is good. Electric car is servered quickly, not too much wait. Buffet menu is not interested. Restaurant should add sea food and some special disk to menu.

title: Break
text: It was very different. Did not operate as a western style 5 star hotel. Each department operated in isolation of the other, which caused problems with room service. The hotel isolated you from Phu Quoc, not offering any advice on where to fo and what to see, taxis were not allowed in the complex, I felt I was trapped and somewhat brain washed into there resort. Staff could not speak english, good only buffet style. However, rooms were great, comfortable bed. I am to adventurous to stay at Vin Pearl.

Staff could not speak english, good only buffet style. However, rooms were great, comfortable bed. I am to adventurous to stay at Vin Pearl.

title: Tried to scam money because of early check out.
text: A couple of unpleasant experiences caused us to check out early. Refusal to serve breakfast despite having no customers. Over priced menus and poor customer service. Upon checking out, they tried to charge us more money than the full booking of the time slot would have cost anyway. Bare faced opportunism. Horrible service. Almost ruined our entire holiday.
en_review: A couple of unpleasant experiences caused us to check out early. Refusal to serve breakfast despite having no customers. Over priced menus and poor customer service. Upon checking out, they tried to charge us more money than the full booking of the time slot would have cost anyway. Bare faced opportunism. Horrible service. Almost ruined our entire holiday.

title: Prima hotel
text: Bescheiden geven ze een ster aan, voor mij zijn het er echt wel twee. Airoco en verwanrming op de kamer, prima bed en douche, schoon. Gastvrije ontvangst. Gelegen in het centrum van het stadje, vlakbij het uitgaanscentrum
en_review: Bescheiden geven ze een ster aan, voor mij zijn het er echt wel twee. Airoco en verwanrming op de kamer, prima bed en douche, schoon. Gastvrije ontvangst. Gelegen in het centrum van het stadje, vlakbij het uitgaanscentrum

title: Pretty hotel, bad customer service...
text: I booked this hotel to celebrate my parent's birthday. The hotel itself is well-designed with a touch of Vietnamese Buddhism. However, the staffs are badly trained, I heard they are all temporary workers due to low tourism demand (Covid19). I booked the restaurant days in advance and when we showed up, there are no table available, the staff suggests to set a table for us in the restaurant Hallway, what the hell is that about? I've been to hundreds of hotel and this is not 5 star hotel customer service, this is motel on the side of the road quality. There are more little annoying things as well that makes the stay not very pleasant.

title: Très mauvais rapport qualité prix
text: L'hôtel a été pensé avec goût et le bungalow dans lequel nous étions était très mignon mais: 1) à l'arrivée, personne pour nous expliquer le fonctionnement de l'hôtel 2) en trois jours personne ne nous a fait le ménage (et ensuite, le dernier jour on nous explique que les personnes en charge du menage n'ont pas osé car nous n'avions ps laissé les clefs à l'accueil - évidement personne ne nous avait dit qu'il fallait le faire) 3) la nourriture de l'hôtel n'est pas bonne et nous avons eu d'énormes crampes d'estomac durant tout le séjour 4) le personnel est gentil mais il n'ont pas du tout le sens du service. Ils n'ont jamais de solutions aux problèmes que l'on peut avoir. 5) nous avons loué un scooter à l'hôtel qui est tombé en panne et nous avons néanmoins du payer.. 6) la dame qui s'occupe du spa est très gentille mais ne parle que vietnamien et ne sait absolument ps faire les manucures 7) très maigre filet d'eau dans la douche et pas d'eau chaude 8) literie problématique car le drap de dessous est en fait un drap de dessus qui s'enlève chaque nuit. De plus la moustiquaire était salle.

title: Comfortable
text: We stayed here for 2 nights and enjoyed it lots. The room was very large and spacious, nice and clean. The owners are very nice, they were waiting for us when we got off the bus from Hue. They have a restaurant so you can have breakfast and dinner, and they book tours as well. They kindly let us shower in the evening after checking out, before we got our night bus. Good location on the main street in Phong Nha. Would recommend to stay here.
en_review: We stayed here for 2 nights and enjoyed it lots. The room was very large and spacious, nice and clean. The owners are very nice, they were waiting for us when we got off the bus from Hue. They have a restaurant so you can have breakfast and dinner, and they book tours as well. They kindly let us shower in the evening after checking out, before we got our night bus. Good location on the main street in Phong Nha. Would recommend to stay here.

title: Dejeuner agréable
text: Nous avons déjeuné sur la terrasse de ce restaurant. Panorama magnifique et apaisant avec vue sur le lac avec piscine en contrebas. Repas vietnamien excellent et bien présenté. Service un peu lent et un peu brouillon mais qui permet de faire une pause entre deux excursions.
en_review: Nous avons déjeuné sur la terrasse de ce restaurant. Panorama magnifique et apaisant avec vue sur le lac avec piscine en contrebas. Repas vietnamien excellent et bien présenté. Service un peu lent et un peu brouillon mais qui permet de faire une pause entre deux excursions.

title: Kinh nghiệm tồi, quá ồn ào, đánh giá giả
text: Khách sạn thất vọng nhất, vợ chồng tôi ở lại vào thời gian cuối cùng chúng tôi đi du lịch vài ngày quanh Ninh Bình. Chúng tôi đã đặt một phòng nữ hoàng sang trọng có ban công và sân thượng vào phút cuối thông qua Đặt phòng. com sau khi kiểm tra 24 đánh giá gần như đánh giá rất cao (9. 9). Chúng tôi đến sảnh với bất kỳ nhân viên nào bên trong, sau đó chúng tôi phải mất vài phút để vào bếp để tìm một cô gái với chiếc áo ngắn và áo phông (dịch vụ rất kém và cách xa dịch vụ của 3 STAR Hotel những gì họ thể hiện trực tuyến) . Cô ấy chỉ đưa cho chúng tôi chìa khóa mà không có thêm thông tin - chúng tôi phải yêu cầu thời gian ăn sáng và mật khẩu wifi. Sau đó chúng tôi đứng dậy bằng cầu thang (không có thang máy) Chúng tôi đến trong phòng - rất thất vọng. Phòng không có ban công hoặc sân thượng như mô tả phòng khi đặt phòng. com. Chỉ cần có một cửa sổ mà không có bất kỳ góc nhìn nào - như họ chỉ không biết ý nghĩa của tầm nhìn, ban công và sân thượng, căn phòng cũng không có TV, giống như chỉ có giường. Chúng tôi xuống và phàn nàn với cô gái. Cô ấy nói như thể cô ấy không biết sân thượng, ban công và tầm nhìn có ý nghĩa gì, sau đó cô ấy chỉ cho chúng tôi một phòng khác có cửa sổ nhưng vẫn không có ban công hoặc sân thượng nhưng vẫn không có TV và phòng tắm vẫn chưa được làm sạch. Chúng tôi phải hủy đặt phòng thậm chí chúng tôi phải trả tiền phạt nhưng may mắn là không. Chúng tôi ra ngoài và rất mệt mỏi để tìm một khách sạn khác. Bước tiếp theo, cô gái đi theo chúng tôi và cố gắng thương lượng. Chúng tôi quyết định ở lại với thỏa thuận của cô ấy trong phòng thứ hai. Cô lấy một chiếc TV và đặt trong phòng nhưng nó không hoạt động (tôi chắc chắn mình đang cố sửa nó). Có bữa tiệc từ những vị khách khác quanh hồ bơi vào buổi tối, điều khiến căn phòng trở nên nặng mùi và ồn ào, ồn ào đến tận nửa đêm. Khách khác bơi và nói chuyện, chơi nhạc rất lớn lúc 11 tuổi. 30 giờ chiều. Chúng tôi đã kiểm tra vào sáng hôm sau mà không ăn sáng và một kinh nghiệm tồi tệ. Tôi nghĩ rằng tất cả các đánh giá về Đặt phòng. com là giả. Khách sạn rất cơ bản, không có tường kính trong phòng tắm. Sàn nhà rất ẩm ướt, không có giấy vệ sinh. Các nhân viên nói với chúng tôi rằng khách sạn chưa được thực hiện. Nhưng tại sao họ lại bắt người dân ở khách sạn không? ? ? Vị trí khách sạn là xa trung tâm. Không bao giờ ở đây một lần nữa, tránh xa khách sạn UNPROFESSIONAL này. Có rất nhiều khách sạn / nhà trọ xung quanh Tam Cốc thì còn gì tuyệt vời hơn.

title: Đang được tân trang - nhà xây dựng ở mọi nơi
text: Khách sạn cũ đang được cải tạo. Một số tầng không sử dụng. Bắt đầu trên tầng 4 nhưng hành lang đầy bụi và cửa ra vào với khăn để thử và giữ bụi. Đã chuyển đến tầng 7 sạch hơn. Một số bức tranh hoàn thành nhưng đồ nội thất cũ và chỉ có hai ổ cắm, một trong số đó được ẩn ở giữa đầu giường dưới gối. Chỉ có một thang máy làm việc như những người khác được sử dụng bởi công nhân và cầu thang đến tầng bị chiếm đóng bởi các nhà xây dựng vào ban ngày. Hồ bơi không được làm sạch trong nhiều ngày và lớp lá và cặn bã trên đầu. Mong đợi một số sự gián đoạn và như chỉ một nửa khách sạn khá trong khu vực ok cho vài ngày. Bên cạnh chất lượng thức ăn phụ tốt và đồ uống rất rẻ.
en_review: Khách sạn cũ đang được cải tạo. Một số tầng không sử dụng. Bắt đầu trên tầng 4 nhưng hành lang đầy bụi và cửa ra vào với khăn để thử và giữ bụi. Đã chuyển đến tầng 7 sạch hơn. Một số bức tranh hoàn thành nhưng đồ nội thất cũ và chỉ có hai ổ cắm, một trong số đó được ẩn ở giữa đầu giường dưới gối. Chỉ có một thang máy làm việc như những người khác được sử dụng bởi công nhân và cầu thang đến tầng bị chiếm đóng bởi các nhà xây dựng vào ban ngày. Hồ bơi không được làm sạch trong nhiều ngày và lớp lá và cặn bã trên đầu. Mong đợi một số sự gián đoạn và như chỉ một nửa khách sạn khá trong khu vực ok cho vài ngày. Bên cạnh chất lượng thức ăn phụ tốt và đồ uống rất rẻ.

title: Special architechture in a beautiful place!
text: we just have 1 night stay here in forest villa on 18th-september. •The staff here especially driver and security staff - they're always helpful, friendly and very polite!!! •The facilities here were very new and modern. • Architecture : very impress with the architecture here, very special!!!‎ • Food : delicious and plentiful. • Beverage : Good and especially very fresh ( our family with children just order juice for drink). • Value for money: it's worth to spend about 100$ for 1 night stay here with breakfast, swimming pool, 1 hour kayak, 1 hour for Bi-a snooker included in our package ( i booked through booking.com and my family with 1 daughter 4 years old, 1 daughter 4 months) but we have higher expectation for this "one of top ten resort" * My suggestion : • Improve communication skill for receptionist ( my wife told me that she never heard about "thank you" after she settle the bill. • Must be clear in advance about extra fee ( booking.com send me an email that the wedding anniversary cake for me just 400.000 vnd and i did paid right the moment when i check in then next day they told me i have to pay more 5000 vnd for that cake that's not a big deal but the way they explained is unacceptable and i wasn't satisfied in this case). Also if they want to sell the minibar,the mineral water should be different with complimentary(so funny if somebody charge you 2 complimentary water just 48000vnd because it was set up inside the minibar ) • Should have a manager in-charge for restaurant ( i didn't see any manager even in bamboo wings restaurant or forest restaurant, it's hard for staff if the guest complain about the food and the staff just explain without action from manager and i'm sure that that guest will be not happy) ● the last i think is the most important : should be give the guest more assistant when they arrive(my family came here by taxi and they just told us the way to get to forest villa instead they should tell us that we can take an electric car ) However,I still give 4 stars(indeed my wife said just worth 3 stars but she a kind of difficult guest haha) in general for this resort and looking forward to see the improvement for the next time we come!

title: Need to address cleaning issues & maintainence
text: I'll start by saying the staff are really friendly, always have a smile, are helpful and try to be as accommodating as possible. We were met off the bus with fruit & water and when we left at 4.15am, were given crackers, water & bananas for the bus journey. The room rate is cheap -$12 for private double and this includes a substantial enough breakfast. However.... We arrived to dirty sheets, a dirty bathroom floor, no towels and freezing water. Luckily we are travelling with sleeping bags and it was only for one night. Upon returning from our 2 day cave trek ( the room was prebooked on booking.com with no refund so we couldn't look elsewhere) we were given the same room & when I asked about hot water was told it was available. Thankfully the sheets had been changed and the bathroom floor cleaned. Unfortunately though there was no hot water. We asked the staff to look at it and they then said the light wasn't on the boiler so it wasn't working. They changed our room immediately but we had to ask them to change the sheets as these were dirty. I also cleaned the bathroom as this still had toothpaste in the sink from previous occupants. The shower however worked and gave excellent hot water! Whilst there the main light in the room blew. A new bulb didn't remedy the issue so they plugged in a flex and bulb to give us light. I totally expected Phong Nha accommodation to be rough & ready but clean bedding is an absolute basic. Even though the staff were lovely I wouldn't stay here again due to the cleanliness issues. Heritage by Night looked a good option from the outside. Phong Nha is lovely though but quite a few little bars & restaurants, and of course Easy Tiger for more social beers.

Heritage by Night looked a good option from the outside. Phong Nha is lovely though but quite a few little bars & restaurants, and of course Easy Tiger for more social beers.

title: Rooms need major renovation
text: The hotel is only 2 years old and to my surprise, it has became very dirty, specially the bathroom "Mold has covered the entire bathroom". I am planning to come back to the area in the near future and I definitely will not come back to this hotel and will not recommend this hotel to anyone.
en_review: The hotel is only 2 years old and to my surprise, it has became very dirty, specially the bathroom "Mold has covered the entire bathroom". I am planning to come back to the area in the near future and I definitely will not come back to this hotel and will not recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Chuyến đi tuyệt vời
text: * Nhân viên: Điểm cộng: nhân viên chuyển đồ cho khách, bảo vệ, cứu hộ, house kepping rất nhiệt tình hỗ trợ khách... Điểm trừ: không có * Phòng ốc: Điểm cộng: phòng mới, rộng rãi, phòng tông trắng sạch sẽ tươi mát. Có két sắt, dép nhựa, dù, móc áo...Máy lạnh, minibar nhanh lạnh. Nhà tắm đủ đồ dùng gội, xả, sữa tắm, lotion, máy sấy tóc... Điểm trừ : nhà tắm thiết kế phong cách hoàng gia cổ xưa, không có vòi xịt toa lét, chỉ có giấy vệ sinh, hơi bất tiện. * Ăn uống: Điểm cộng: buffet sáng ngon, nhiều món dù đi trong tuần, có đủ món việt lẫn món âu, trái cây, bánh ngọt...có thay đổi món mỗi ngày, nước uống cũng đa dạng (chanh dây, nước cam, sữa bắp, đậu xanh...). Đặc biệt có món bánh khọt, bánh bèo nổi tiếng của vũng tàu , bánh khọt giòn giòn nước chấm rất ngon ❤ Điểm trừ: bánh su kem buffet sáng 06.04 không thích lắm, vỏ bánh hơi cứng, kem trong bánh thì ngọt và đặc quá, ăn hơi ngấy => góp ý nhỏ, nhà hàng điều chỉnh lại nhé * Tiện nghi, Không gian: Điểm cộng: hồ bơi rộng, đẹp, lát gạch xanh mát thích hợp sống ảo, có bồn jacuzzi, hồ bơi không sâu lăm, max tầm 1m50, ́có hồ bơi cho trẻ em bên cạnh kid club... Nước hồ bơi sạch, không bị nhiều thuốc tẩy, bơi rất thích. Có vanilla spa, đi trong tuần được giảm 20%, có bãi biển... Điểm trừ: hồ bơi nhiều cầu quá, cầu cách mặt nước cũng cao, nhưng vẫn nên cẩn thận kẻo bị đụng đầu Chuyến đi tuyệt vời, sẽ quay lại sớm 😆😆

title: Amazing place to stay
text: We stayed two nights in Bac Ha for the weekend and very glad we came across this place. The owners and their family are really nice and we enjoyed two family dinners with them, the food was excellent. The rooms are large, clean and the beds are comfortable. It has a great location, right by the lake and for the Sunday market. Highly recommended
en_review: We stayed two nights in Bac Ha for the weekend and very glad we came across this place. The owners and their family are really nice and we enjoyed two family dinners with them, the food was excellent. The rooms are large, clean and the beds are comfortable. It has a great location, right by the lake and for the Sunday market. Highly recommended

title: 夕陽に時間を忘れました。
text: ビーチサイドヴィラに3泊しました。 フーコック自体が初めてだったのと、相方の要望で「夕陽が綺麗なロケーション」ということで、マップで位置を確認しながら、ほんとに浜に直近の場所をと思い決めました。 ほぼ波打際にヴィラがあり、間に芝生、立地は問題ありませんでしたヴィラも計36室との事で、他のホテルより少なめ？で、プライベート感もあり、ビーチスタッフもよく働きストレス無く過ごせました。 ただ、浜からの出入りが多くなるのですが、「足拭きマット」が無いため、多少の砂が部屋に入り易いです。足洗い用の水瓶は用意されていますが、やはりどうしても入ってしまいますね。 出来ればマットの設置があればと思いました。 部屋は、寝室とバスルームのみでシンプルですが、この立地なので十分ですね。何もしないでビーチベッドで一日中過ごせば、シャワーを浴びて寝るだけですから。宿泊客数が少ないためでしょうが、レストランが一軒しかありません。料理は美味しいのですが、やはり品数が限られています。長期滞在の場合は考慮が必要かと。 周辺には、めぼしい食堂もありません。 ヴィラですが、キッチンも付帯していません。 しいて言えば、気になる方がいればそういった所でしょうか。 なかなかビーチリゾートでのんびりした経験が無いのですが、ここは来年もう一回来てもいいな…と思える場所でした。 因みに日本語は通じません、が、必要ないですね。

title: Step back in time
text: 5 hours drive North of Saigon, you will take a step back from loud, noisy traffic, loud music from bars and restaurants at every next shop. Don’t come here looking for souvenirs as, there are few and far between The Aniise resort, has a modest but tasty breakfast, comfortable beds, clean rooms with en-suite. There are various swimming pools and of course next to a very long , sandy beach. If it’s peace and quiet you are after. Here you will find it. There are, restaurants in town that you will find great, inexpensive meals. Beer can be bought local.. It's not a surfers beach but it's great for romantic getaway. There are also fantastic places to visit only a hour away where there is floating restaurant. Pick your fish, lobster, squid...they jump in and get it. Try the roasted Sea Urchin..small but delicious. Aniise resort is out of the way and ideal to get away from rush and bustle..

Try the roasted Sea Urchin..small but delicious. Aniise resort is out of the way and ideal to get away from rush and bustle..

title: Wonderful experience
text: We are travel agents from the US and I was intrigued by the web site and booked 3 nights here. It was AMAZING! We spent time walking the rice fields, visiting the caves, taking a jeep ride in a US jeep left over from the war. The food was great staff can't do enough for you. One highlight was having drinks with Ben the Aussie owner with a great personality and interesting story. Also Leslie the lady at the front desk was personality plus and could not do enough to make us happy. After spending a month in Vietnam I can say that the farmstay was one of the highlights Kudos to the staff

One highlight was having drinks with Ben the Aussie owner with a great personality and interesting story. After spending a month in Vietnam I can say that the farmstay was one of the highlights Kudos to the staff

title: Amazing place, excellent staff
text: My friends and I came in on the 4 am night bus from Hanoi. The hotel owner greeted us at the bus, and was so helpful the entirety of our stay. I cannot recommend this place highly enough--she was friendly, helpful with the fact that our bus was leaving in the middle of night the next day, and was available at reception around the clock. The hotel is also right next to Easy Tiger, which is nice if you're looking to party but still want to go home to somewhere quiet and comfortable. There is no better deal for the price, and the bathrooms were clean, with great rain shower heads, and hot water!! Would definitely stay here again. Thank you!!

I cannot recommend this place highly enough--she was friendly, helpful with the fact that our bus was leaving in the middle of night the next day, and was available at reception around the clock. The hotel is also right next to Easy Tiger, which is nice if you're looking to party but still want to go home to somewhere quiet and comfortable. There is no better deal for the price, and the bathrooms were clean, with great rain shower heads, and hot water!! Would definitely stay here again. Thank you!!

title: best hotel in our VN trip
text: Booked by our travel agency. What a surprise! Very nice design. Simplest yet luxurious. Agency had reserve a garden side bungalow which may be better than river front (barge may be noisy). We particularly liked the lotus flower we could see from our balcony. Pool is great... but go early as bugs come when sun goes out. Restaurant is very nicely laid out. Be patient with staff as their proficiency in western languages ... can be improved... but food quality is good. Wine list is sufficient (got Provence rose). Dining room is very large with huge deck; this is good as groups can be somewhat isolated from (quieter) couples. Breakfast buffet is world class. They have a dock where you can arrange for tour boat to take you to nearby floating market etc... We definitively recommend this boutique hotel.

We particularly liked the lotus flower we could see from our balcony. Pool is great... but go early as bugs come when sun goes out. Restaurant is very nicely laid out. Dining room is very large with huge deck; this is good as groups can be somewhat isolated from (quieter) couples. Breakfast buffet is world class. They have a dock where you can arrange for tour boat to take you to nearby floating market etc... We definitively recommend this boutique hotel.

title: Lovely place but needs some improvements.....service
text: Stayed for two nights on our way to Shinoukville. This place is gorgeous as is the island - town has great markets - great food there as well - and although it is a way from town - (45 minutes plus from town and airport)...it is very pretty with a lovely beach (very strong currents though and rough when we were there - Monsoon season). Food was a disappointment - no pizza ! Oven but not making pizza - found some other food on the menu that was okay. Need some English training for tourists as we struggled several times trying to make arrangements and get into town - nice room / chalet - maybe a bit quirky in terms of design. Staff training in English and the hospitality industry would help improve the experience for guests - their restaurant in town Carole's was just excellent and we had a great night there listening to the awesome band - good English there. Expect to pay about 400,000 Duong for taxis from town/airport. One day this island will be discovered but at the moment it is a bit sleepy/touristy/maybe even pricey compared to the rest of Vietnam but beautiful. Struggled to find out about the high speed ferry for example (it is an island and they should be able to tell people how to get on and off it!) - we figured out the ferry our selves and just made it as they had committed to drive someone to the airport and we realized we would miss our ferry if we did that so we met another taxi on main street and switched taxis. We were going on to Cambodia from here. Very stressful and it should have been easy - ferry was great as was our tour operator in mainland Vietnam.

Food was a disappointment - no pizza ! Oven but not making pizza - found some other food on the menu that was okay. Need some English training for tourists as we struggled several times trying to make arrangements and get into town - nice room / chalet - maybe a bit quirky in terms of design. Staff training in English and the hospitality industry would help improve the experience for guests - their restaurant in town Carole's was just excellent and we had a great night there listening to the awesome band - good English there. Expect to pay about 400,000 Duong for taxis from town/airport. One day this island will be discovered but at the moment it is a bit sleepy/touristy/maybe even pricey compared to the rest of Vietnam but beautiful. Struggled to find out about the high speed ferry for example (it is an island and they should be able to tell people how to get on and off it!) - we figured out the ferry our selves and just made it as they had committed to drive someone to the airport and we realized we would miss our ferry if we did that so we met another taxi on main street and switched taxis. We were going on to Cambodia from here. Very stressful and it should have been easy - ferry was great as was our tour operator in mainland Vietnam.

title: Une joli ressort dans l'eco tourisme
text: Seulement à 12kms d'Hô Chi Minh City, un ressort d'un très bon rapport qualité prix avec toutes les commodités d'un très bon hôtel dans un écrin de verdure protégé. Préférer la chambre deluxe à celle de base car la différence de prix est raisonnable. Très bon accueil et service aux petits soins. De très jolis temples et un site de baignade dans la nature pas très loin et pas connu des touristes.
en_review: Seulement à 12kms d'Hô Chi Minh City, un ressort d'un très bon rapport qualité prix avec toutes les commodités d'un très bon hôtel dans un écrin de verdure protégé. Préférer la chambre deluxe à celle de base car la différence de prix est raisonnable. Très bon accueil et service aux petits soins. De très jolis temples et un site de baignade dans la nature pas très loin et pas connu des touristes.

title: If you happened to arrive to Ca Bei, this is a good hotel
text: It is confusing to write about this hotel. If you go with the "insiders deals" of Agoda you will be miss led! You will get a great price for stinks, dirty rooms and actually a different hotel! Only there you will realized that they have another building that cost much more (instead of $5.5 you'll pay $20) for the rooms that you see in the pictures on Agoda. These are very nice and clean rooms. The owner, although he knows one or two words in English, is wonderful and did his best to help us! And he did help. I would not trust the info on Agoda. And anyway, Ca Bei should be a night station only if you happened to arrive there. Do not fall to the "floating market" tour. There is no market there anymore.

You will get a great price for stinks, dirty rooms and actually a different hotel! title: 大失所望
text: 2014年4月7日-10日入住该酒店，印象极差！ 1.酒店是典型的豆腐渣工程。开业不过才一年多，外墙大面积起泡脱落。房间内部装修完全经不起细看，材料和做工根本就不配五星级度假村标准。去的时侯正好看到主楼很多地方都在重新返工。酒店园林绿化也做得不好，基本上都是新移栽的小树子。 2.服务水平完全可称得上是水货级的。我们到的第一天发现房间冰箱里还有以前住客留下没喝完的矿泉水，每天客房补货服务员不是忘了补茶包就是忘了补咖啡。好像完全是凭心情好坏在服务。所有服务人员完全没有五星级的服务热情，基本上你不主动招呼他，他就面无表情擦肩走过。我们住的是一楼的山景房（后面有一小花园那种），正好花园门口有一垃圾箱。入住第一晚的看到堆那儿的垃圾连续两天都没人来收拾，直到离开前一晚发出恶臭了我打电话发飙才有人来收走。 3.最奇葩的事来了！服务人员居然偷客人财物！当时我女友放了张一百块的人民币在小挎包里，小挎包就挂衣柜里。前两天都没事，第三天从顺化耍完回房间发现小挎包里外都被人翻了个遍。那张考验越南人民道德底线的红嘟嘟不出所料的消失了......

title: Don't Bother
text: Don't bother making a reservation. My boyfriend and I made one online, and when we got there, we were told there were no rooms left. He didn't even care when I showed him our reservation. Luckily there were many hotels on the same street that had very similar prices ($10-$14).
en_review: Don't bother making a reservation. My boyfriend and I made one online, and when we got there, we were told there were no rooms left. He didn't even care when I showed him our reservation. Luckily there were many hotels on the same street that had very similar prices ($10-$14).

title: Limited security
text: We stayed in the house with the family, in the beautiful rural setting, though there is currently some building of more bungalows for guest accommodation. As mentioned by other reviewers there is limited privacy, only a curtain between the bed and the rest of the house. We weren't offered anywhere to lock up our valuables in the house, though for those staying in the dorm room there were lockers. Before we arrived we had checked what cash we had in us as we are on a tight budget. Unfortunately during our stay American dollars and Vietnamese dong went missing from our bags that we left by our bed the day we went to visit the caves and we hadn't spent it. The family were made aware of the situation as soon as we noticed this and they returned an email 48 hours after notification (by this time we had left) only to say no one in the family was involved. It was a shame this occurred as this tainted an otherwise lovely experience of visiting a beautiful part of the world.

title: Serene heavenly location
text: A magical place to unwind in if you want to escape the rat race and recharge. Do as much or as little as you want here, daily shuttle available to take you to certain towns, or you can go on a tour planned by the hotel as listed in their brochures but are quite pricey. We took the free hotel shuttle to the towns and than got in a taxi to do the sight seeing to suit our interests. Taxis are metered or you can negotiate a price with the taxi driver. The hotel staff are extremely friendly and eager to assist you, food was very fresh and excellent sized portions.

The hotel staff are extremely friendly and eager to assist you, food was very fresh and excellent sized portions.

title: De dónde sale tanto buen comentario...
text: Después de leer muy buenas opiniones de este establecimiento nos sorprendió negativamente llegar a ese sitio: habitación grande con cagadas de pájaro por tas partes, baño inundable, desayuno deficiente (margarina caducada y a saber qué más), servicio de bus malísimo (nos metió en un bus que no quedaba sitio y tuvimos que ir de cualquier manera)...Creo que podríamos haber caído en un mejor hotel con unas opiniones de experiencias reales.

title: Bạn có hai lựa chọn ...
text: . . . Ở đây, hoặc Khách sạn Xanh mới khai trương gần đây. Rất có thể là nếu bạn đang đọc này (bằng tiếng Anh) bạn đang đi xe máy qua Việt Nam và thực sự không có bất kỳ lựa chọn thay thế trong thị trấn. Nó khá nhiều công việc, các phòng khá sạch sẽ, vòi sen ấm áp. Không ai giới thiệu nơi này bởi vì nó tuyệt vời, nhưng bởi vì là một trong số ít các tùy chọn trong thị trấn.

title: Quality needs to improve
text: We have visited many resorts in Vietnam with our family. This beach resort has a great beach that is not at all busy so one can find ones own space. There was lifeguard control and a distance ' barrier' near to shore. Not really for swimming just good for a dip. Breakfast very much for locals as was the room. Room service was adequate but rooms not spotless. This is an ageing resort with both mature and new locations so choose carefully. Just manages three star in our opinion. The edges are frayed on everything including the service. In our opinion this is the main quality problem that needs urgent attention to make this a better resort.
hotelName: Khu nghỉ dưỡng Bãi biển Lăng Cô

The edges are frayed on everything including the service. In our opinion this is the main quality problem that needs urgent attention to make this a better resort.

title: Médiocre
text: Je pense que nous n'avons pas séjourné dans le même endroit quand je vois les commentaires récents. Prestation très médiocre pour un prix exorbitant. Nos chambres sentaient la moisissure et l'humidité, lits très inconfortables, salle de bain d'un autre âge. Repas également très chers et pas copieux du tout. Nous avons payé 250000 par personne pour le barbecue, nous avons eu 2 assiettes de bâtonnets de légumes non assaisonnés, un plateau de grillades pour 5, une assiette de frites pour 5, une minuscule coupe de glace, boissons non incluses, c'est scandaleux! Les travailleurs ont voulu faire des travaux pendant que nous étions au nord de la piscine, nous avons dû râler pour être au calme (ils ont voulu activer les remous de la piscine pour couvrir le bruit des ponceuses...). Deco très vieillotte qui s'apparente à une accumulation de bibelots et qui donne au domaine l'apparence d'une brocante géante à la limite du glauque. Le site entier aurait besoin d'un coup de frais et manque cruellement d'entretien. Au petit déjeuner nous avons également dû réclamer des portions plus copieuses. Au vue des prix pratiqués c'est plus qu'une déception et presque un scandale!
hotelName: La Ferme du Colvert Spa Ecolodge

Au vue des prix pratiqués c'est plus qu'une déception et presque un scandale!

title: Never let an architect design a hotel room
text: The resort is on a vast scale so don't forget anything when going to the centre but the rooms are a major disappointment. There are no chairs of any sort and sofas, too long to sit on but too short to lie on, are preferred. The lighting is low so beware of poorly lit steps because the rooms are on several levels. The loo and bathroom lights,adjoining and illuminating the bedroom, are on one switch so all join in the nocturnal visit. The low light is also feature of of the bathroom so women are unable to see their makeup nor men their shaving. The work desk is accessed by stepping into a hole in the ground which is very trendy but somewhat inconvenient. A triumph, in short, of form over function but perhaps the client was pleased. However, he probably has not had to stay in the rooms neither has the architect. . . .

title: Great place but very uncomfortable bed
text: We had a wonderful 7 nights maybe to long as there is not much to do other than eat sleep relax just chill out,but we woke up every morning with arching body's the beds are poorly designed and very hard I mean hard. Apart from that the resort was fantastic, the people so helpful and friendly, The massages were the best , the food and wine wonderful. We had a beachfront villa walked out and swam every morning, the rooms are a god size very basic , don't expect 5 star style like city hotels this is a bit alternative and rustic. I loved it the wife was not so empressed. All the bathrooms amenities were good clean towels twice daily, turn down with chocolates and a lovely story to read , nice touches.

title: Cacophony of bird sounds and ineffective air conditioning !
text: Have to agree generally with previous reviewer (dawnvip) about the Du Hung Hotel 2. Only stayed here because Du Hung 1 down the road is currently under renovation. Main complaints were the constant cacophony of bird sounds which permeated the hotel 24 hours per day and the air conditioning which seemed to have little effect on the room temperature, even when adjusted to 17°C and maximum fan ! English spoken at the reception was limited but they did try to assist and will offer discounts if staying for more than a couple of nights. The room was serviced daily. On the positive side, however, the rooms are large and spacious and the shower delivers a good pressure with plenty of hot water. Wi Fi signal in the room was very good. The mattress was quite firm. OK for me, but some may find too hard (not uncommon in Vietnam though). There is a plaque at the entrance stating this to be an official 2 star hotel. I would not disagree with that rating.

OK for me, but some may find too hard (not uncommon in Vietnam though). There is a plaque at the entrance stating this to be an official 2 star hotel. I would not disagree with that rating.

title: Paradies.. bis auf das Lunch-/Dinner-Angebot.
text: Tolles Resort mit allem, was man von den Hotels erwartet: klasse Service, abgeschottete Hüttchen, die viel Ruhe versprechen, malerische Kulisse, breites Freizeitangebot, sehr feines Frühstücksbuffet. Dazu passt leider garnicht, was mittags bzw. abends im Restaurant angeboten wird: einfallslos, lieblos angerichtet und nicht wirklich wohlschmeckende Gerichte - dies hat uns sehr enttäuscht. Zumal das Buffet am Morgen sehr vielversprechend ist.. und man in einem solchen Resort doch eine etwas andere Küche erwartet.

title: 빈펄 디스커버리 리조트(Phu Quoc)
text: 정말 아름다운 곳 이었습니다. 아름다운 열대 식물과 아름다운 리조트... 친절하고 아름다운 직원들.. Discovery1 로비의 Yen nhi 직원은 한국어로 인사와 안내를 해주었는데, 유창하지는 않지만 최대한 노력을 하여 주어 감사하였습니다.. SABBIA의 Mr.Liem (Discovery2)은 풀장에서의 음식서비스에 있어 친절한 응대로 감동을 주었습니다..

title: A very tatty hotel - suprisingly good food.
text: Our room was quite large and reasonably clean. The hotel was probably reasonably smart about 25 years ago. However, now the fixtures and fittings are at a bit tired and grotty. All the carpets in the communal areas have big stains and the whole place looks like it could do with a refurbishment. The staff seemed reasonably friendly but nobody could speak a word of English (to be fair, I could not speak any Vietnamese either!) There also seemed to be a problem with rats in the roof space which were incredibly noisy during the night as they scuttled about. Our rooms which were both similarly affected were on the top floor so it might not be a problem on lower floors. The restaurant was surprisingly good.

title: Another great stay ar Angsana Lang Co
text: We returned to Angsana after our first visit 4 years ago and it was equally as impressive. From the staff, to the rooms, the food and the care taken by everyone involved it is a great place to visit. The beach is virtually untouched and clean - safe and easy to swim at. There is plenty to do from Golf to Water Sports and Cycling, yet it's extremely quiet compared to the hustle and bustle around Danang - it's well worth the hour drive north to get away to somewhere so peaceful. If you want action and big city experiences then this is not the answer, Danang has plenty of that. However, if you want a great overall experience, that is also family friendly, then this is the hotel for you. We will definitely be back!

If you want action and big city experiences then this is not the answer, Danang has plenty of that. However, if you want a great overall experience, that is also family friendly, then this is the hotel for you. We will definitely be back!

title: An Amazing Experience
text: Our stay at Angsana was amazing. We stayed at a one bedroom seaview suite. The room was above our expectations, as it is a 2 floor huge suite with a private pool and includes many facilities. In addition, the staff was kind and the free airport shuttles made our arrival and departure very easy. Highly recommended.
en_review: Our stay at Angsana was amazing. We stayed at a one bedroom seaview suite. The room was above our expectations, as it is a 2 floor huge suite with a private pool and includes many facilities. In addition, the staff was kind and the free airport shuttles made our arrival and departure very easy. Highly recommended.

title: Кафе с музыкой
text: Обычный Вьетнамский ресторан со стандартным набором блюд. Цены немного выше, чем у соседей. Вместе с тем, много обслуживающего персонала. Посетители привлекаются живой музыкой. Выступает Филипинская группа, которая часто поет под фонограмму.
en_review: Обычный Вьетнамский ресторан со стандартным набором блюд. Цены немного выше, чем у соседей. Вместе с тем, много обслуживающего персонала. Посетители привлекаются живой музыкой. Выступает Филипинская группа, которая часто поет под фонограмму.

title: Ужасный сервис
text: Отдыхаем в данный момент в отделе Selectum Noa Cam Ranh, но отдыхом это сложно назвать. Отель не по каким параметрам в данный момент не соответствует уровню заявленных 5*. Персонала мало, он совершенно не подготовлен к работе в отеле и тем более в отеле 5*. В отеле до сих пор не проведена послестроительная уборка, грязь в общественных местах. В номерах уборка поверхностная, влажная уборка вообще не проводится. Качество еды и напитков на уровне низкопробного отеля и даже этой некачественной еды не достаточно для проживающих в отеле, выстраиваются очереди на 15-20 мин за яичницей. Пляж грязный , урн нет и местное население там где ест там и бросает объедки . Так как за территорию отеля не выпускают, заняться на территории нечем . Анимация , это одно название группы из 4х человек . Про антиковид меры отдельная история. Они действуют только для туристов из Россиии . Местное население, которое проживает в отеле , заселяется беспрепятственно и даже без измерения температуры тела. В общем, пока Selectum Noa Cam Ranh не готов к качественному приему гостей и предоставлению услуг уровня 5*.

title: Idylic spot
text: We stayed over Xmas for two days. The resort was very quiet, food good and the swimming pool area glorious. We made use of Happy Hour and the two cocktails for one! The barman took awhile to make the cocktails and I do think the resort needs a general lick of paint. But overall a good stay and value for money.
en_review: We stayed over Xmas for two days. The resort was very quiet, food good and the swimming pool area glorious. We made use of Happy Hour and the two cocktails for one! The barman took awhile to make the cocktails and I do think the resort needs a general lick of paint. But overall a good stay and value for money.

title: Screaming trẻ em và khách lớn / gia đình!
text: Sau khi đọc nhiều bài đánh giá, rất lộn xộn, chúng tôi đến với một tâm trí cởi mở. Đó là một khách sạn mới và luôn có những nỗi đau khi các nhà quản lý tìm ra các lỗi. Chúng tôi ở lại trong 3 đêm, nhưng sẽ sớm được kiểm tra nếu chúng tôi không có chuyến tham quan buổi sáng sớm và không muốn gặp rắc rối khi thay đổi khách sạn. Tiếng ồn thật lố bịch! Tôi là một giáo viên và yêu trẻ em, cười và chơi tiếng ồn là để được mong đợi. Tuy nhiên, trong trường hợp này, nó la hét, la hét, dậm chân vào mọi giờ. Các bậc cha mẹ gần như là xấu nói chuyện trong các hội trường không có xem xét cho khách đồng. Họ cũng nghĩ rằng không có gì để cắt móng tay và để chúng trên sàn trong khu vực ăn sáng. Tổng! Những gia đình này đã ở đây trong suốt thời gian lưu trú của chúng tôi và không rõ liệu họ chỉ là những người bạn đồng hành hay sống trong khách sạn vì trẻ em thường được nhìn thấy phía sau bàn đặt chỗ ở sảnh đợi. Các phòng đã ac xuất sắc và một fan hâm mộ bổ sung, quan điểm đáng yêu từ ban công và đã được khá sạch sẽ (một số kiến). Ăn sáng là tốt với nhiều lựa chọn. Quầy bar trên tầng mái của Mamma D’S có tầm nhìn tuyệt vời và du khách nên thử món bellini đào đông lạnh của mình. Ngon! Nó có một vòi hoa sen mà một số có thể thích, nhưng nếu bạn đánh giá cao áp lực nước tốt, đây không phải là vòi sen cho bạn.

title: Poor service
text: This was the worst hotel we stayed at during our month in Vietnam. Room standard is not very good with bugs getting into the room from outside through big holes in the walls. The room was rather cheap though, 15$, and we just stayed for the night so we didn't make a fuss about it. The worse part was the attitude of the staff. We found it very hard to communicate, which seemed to be the case due to staffs uninterest rather than English skills. Also, breakfast was supposed to be included, but we didn't get any.
en_review: This was the worst hotel we stayed at during our month in Vietnam. Room standard is not very good with bugs getting into the room from outside through big holes in the walls. The room was rather cheap though, 15$, and we just stayed for the night so we didn't make a fuss about it. The worse part was the attitude of the staff. We found it very hard to communicate, which seemed to be the case due to staffs uninterest rather than English skills. Also, breakfast was supposed to be included, but we didn't get any.

title: 最初はえ~っ⁉︎
text: レビューを見て予約をしました。 とても静かで、海が綺麗と言う事だったので来て見ました。 着いてビックリしたのがテト休みなのも有りますが、中国人ツアー客の多い事！多い事！ バス6台の団体様が至る所で大暴れで夕方の4時まで休まる事は有りませんでした… ロケーションは最高！ シービューのお部屋をお勧め致します。 お部屋は煉瓦造りですがとても清潔感があり、アメニティーも充実しています。 （蚊取り線香も有りますが、蚊が多いのでスプレー式のワンプッシュの殺虫剤を持って来ると便利です。） 海水も綺麗です！ ビーチクリーンも他のリゾートよりはしっかりやって居ます！ 本当は朝一に全員で毎日やって欲しいぐらいですが… 時季にもよるとは思いますが潮の流れがあるので、泳ぐよりは浸かる程度の海です。 プールは残念ですが、この辺の格安リゾートは何処も同じレベル！ 夕方の4時を過ぎると激変します！ バスツアーのお客さんが帰るととても静かになりリゾート感100倍に！ とてもゆっくりとした時間が流れ始めます。 夕食もレストランでビール🍺2杯、エビ🦐、海鮮焼きそば、海鮮鍋を食べましたが全て美味しかったです。 tax15% 500.000vnd 安くも高くもない値段です。 勿論お腹いっぱい食べて2人でこの値段です。 レビューで不味いと書いてあったので心配していましたが、まるで問題なし！ 料理の味ばかりは好みが違うのであまり参考にしないで下さい。 スパも有るらしいのですが、テト休み中だったのでお休みでした！ 次回挑戦したいと思います。 （値段は200.000vnd〜600.000vnd位が主流の様です） 朝食はバイキングで品数は少ないですが、ミェンガー（ラーメン）が最高に美味かったです！ ここ、ワイルドビーチリゾートにいらっしゃって、食後の散歩をたのしんだ後、部屋から海を眺めながら深呼吸をしてみて下さい。 とっても癒されますよ！ (o^^o) ホーチミン在住の僕が薦めるのはここ！ ホーチミンから海岸線をバイクで走り続けて水質チェックの2日の旅で1.2を争う透明度！ 日本人の観覧数を稼ぐ為の偽ブログに騙されないでくださいねー！ コストパフォーマンスも良く、綺麗、ロケーション、最高なのはここですよ~(o^^o) ここで満足しない人は10万円以上の高級リゾートにいらしてくださいねー！ では！

title: Swandor- семейный отель «все включено»
text: В целом, неплохой отель. Отдыхали семьёй- двое детей 1 год и 3 года. Территория небольшая, пляж хороший, но волны приличные. По еде- выбор хороший, фрукты весь день. Славится здесь детский клуб- ребёнка старше 4х лет можно оставить с 10 утра и до 12 ночи. Накормят, напоят, позанимаются, спать уложат. Ресторан есть в мини-клубе для ребятишек, аниматоры хорошие. Сама игровая так себе- бассейн с шариками, несколько горок, карусельки. Площадка на улице- понравилась, есть где полазать. В 3 года сыну было в клубе интересно. Ребёнку в 1 год там делать было нечего. Из минусов. Номер- в ванной комнате нет принудительной вытяжки. Пахнет канализацией. Нет халатов. Нет бумажных салфеток в номере. Еда- нет йогуртов. От слова совсем. В магазине тоже не продаются. В ресторане при детском клубе есть с 12-14 и 18-20. На практике- через час после открытия детского ресторана его уже не было. На полдник накормить детей- проблема. В снэк баре все жареное, в основном, фаст-фуд. Фрукты, правда, там есть, но многие из них дети не едят (вы кормили 3х-летку маракуйей??). А вот йогурт/творожок или там булочку ребёнку найти на полдник- это надо заранее подготовиться. Игровая- пол неровный, местами плитка пошла волнами, местами плиты зашли друг на друга. Очень небезопасно, все время кто-то запинается и падает. Мини-диско проводится на сцене. Каждый(!!!) вечер с этой сцены падало как минимум 3 ребёнка. Персонал приветливый. Горничные не берут чаевые- очень нас удивили. В общем, отдохнули мы хорошо. На твёрдую 4ку. В соседнем Дессоле, где мы отдыхали год назад, мне больше понравилось.

title: tres mediocre
text: pour y etre aller avec un tour operator je ne connais pas le rapport qualite prix mais je que je puis dire c est que cest un hotel tres bien place au milleu des champs de the avec un tres belle vue sur vues collines hall acceptable chambre et litterie correcte et propre mais un enrme probleme c est tout ce qui concerne les sanitaires absolument pas entretenus depuis.......des annees et tout tombe en ruine baignoire qui se vide dans la salle de bain d ou innondation douche qui fuit dans tous les sans robinets qui fuit ou carrement casses bon pour une nuit ..... mais si on peut aller ailleurs c est mieux ;mais suis j en suis pas sure car tres peu d hotel dans le coin dommage petit dejeuner tres correct vraiment dommage pour le manque d entretien

title: 레스토랑 음식이 맛있는곳
text: 우선 객실은 깨끗하고 쾌적합니다. 침대가 우선 너무 편해서 잠을 푹 자기에 안성맞춤이었습니다. 디너역시 웨스턴 레스토랑에서 먹었는데 가격은 타 레스토랑에 비해 비싼 편이었습니다만 맛은 최고였습니다. 다만 인기 숙소라 투숙객이 많아 오전시간 수영장은 매일 굉장히 붐비는 것이 조금 아쉬웠습니다.

title: Ripped off / charged twice for stay
text: We found this resort online while travelling through Vietnam. We booked directly through the hotels website and received confirmation and reference number. I didnt receive a confirmation email so contacted the hotel who said they hadn't received our booking. We stayed for two nights and paid cash when leaving and asked again about the credit card booking and we were assured by Mrs Thuy (Tonia) that we wouldn't be charged. When we returned to UK we discovered the money had been taken for the credit card (the same day we checked in) by an HG travel of Hanoi. Both they and the hotel deny any knowledge of this which is obviously a lie. Restaurant was terrible, using frozen seafood!. Building work ongoing/ dead animals on the beach! We did have a lovely view from our room but that was the only positive. beautiful setting let down by shoddy service and greed.
hotelName: Khu nghỉ dưỡng Bãi biển Lăng Cô

title: A very nice place to stay
text: An extraordinary location on the beach, between Da Nang and Hoi An. Very good service. Very nice suites despite the bed is not very adequate to elder people. Nice landscape and fabulous service. The only thing that is negative is the huge prices for the food at the restaurants. Really very expensive for the food!
hotelName: Khách sạn Nam Hải Hội An

Nice landscape and fabulous service. The only thing that is negative is the huge prices for the food at the restaurants. Really very expensive for the food!

title: Overpriced
text: We had a very pleasant stay at Oasis. The staff is friendly and helpful. The room was clean and quiet, but small for the price we paid ($30US), and a bit worn out. The hotel is on the other side of the river from Ben Tre, which makes it quiet, but it's remote when you want to access restaurants. The pool is nice and cool.

The hotel is on the other side of the river from Ben Tre, which makes it quiet, but it's remote when you want to access restaurants. The pool is nice and cool.

title: Coi thi THPT
text: Đang sửa chữa nên nhiều thứ còn bề bộn, chưa có thang máy, phòng cũng ko đồng đều giống nhau, phòng có tủ lạnh phòng ko có, tivi phòng LCD phòng tivi thường, phòng có bồn tắm phòng ko có, tuy nhiên phòng sạch đẹp, có máy lạnh, toilet sạch sẽ, view sông, vị trí khá thuận lợi

title: Le matelas de l'angoise / the world's worst mattress
text: Je suis restée 2 nuits au Thinh Vuong Hotel (au lieu de 4) dans une des chambre standard (il existe des chambres "VIP" un petit plus plus cher mais abordable que je conseillerais). L'hotel est bien situé, à quelque minute à pieds de l'Eglise, un peu plus du marché mais c'est tout à fait faisable et juste en face d'un très bon restaurant. L'accueil est sympathique et les chambre propre pour le prix de l'hotel (prenez VOS propre SERVIETTES / ne pas avoir peur de voir la femme de ménage utiliser la même serviettes pour laver les toilettes, la douche, le sol etc). Mais par contre je tiens à vous prévenir que même pour un matelas vietnamien ce fut le pire matelas de ma vie ! Une planche en bois ! J'ai eu la chance de trouver plus tard un ostéopate pour me remettre en place mes côtes qui s'étaient déplacées. Je ne vous fais donc pas de dessin.. Ce qui était aussi beaucoup dérangeant était l'odeur de cigarette.. j'ai du changer 2 fois de chambre car l'odeur étaient insupportable. BREF je conseil cette hotel que si vous prenez les chambre "VIP".

title: Amazing
text: This hotel is amazing! Rooms, food and views are worth every penny and more! The staff are so friendly and helpful! Alex at the front desk made our stay so easy and couldn't have been nicer if he tried!!!! Tanh (owner) thank you and hope to see you soon!
en_review: This hotel is amazing! Rooms, food and views are worth every penny and more! The staff are so friendly and helpful! Alex at the front desk made our stay so easy and couldn't have been nicer if he tried!!!! Tanh (owner) thank you and hope to see you soon!

title: Stressed on an ostensibly stress free vacation
text: Check-in: Hotel lobby is an oven. Told that room key to adjoining suites work on only one door. Problem worked out after some time. Wanted to take a shower the same night: no hot water. Maintenance crew came to the room. Water dark brown for 30 minutes and then cleared. Dinner the same evening: Only guests in the restaurant and couldn’t find the waiter after getting some of our order. Day 2: buffet breakfast. Couldn’t get food because of COVID. Had to order from the table and the waitresses brought what was ordered. A real mess. Refrigerator in room kept drinks just below room temperature. TV guide didn’t come close to reality as channels were not what was published. Didn’t bother to eat the lukewarm food again. Are in restaurants in the city. Advice: try another property.
hotelName: Sheraton Phu Quoc Long Beach Resort

title: Friendly manager!
text: We arrived a sunday morning to see the market. We didn't book any hotel... so we met the manager who proposed to us a room. We stayes 3 days ^^ He was so helpful. He gave us a map and showed how to go by motorbike around and see differents villages. It was amazing! The differents routes were breathless....

He gave us a map and showed how to go by motorbike around and see differents villages. It was amazing! The differents routes were breathless....

title: Vinholiday
text: Khách sạn sạch sẽ, thoáng. Đi với gia đình khá ok. Mọi người ở đây rất nhiệt tình, giả cả phải chăng. Đồ ăn sáng ngon, nhân viên siu dễ thương ạ. Ở đây là sự lựa chọn đúng đắn đó ạaa. Nhân viên Hà Quốc Bảo
