title: All good until check out, staff told me the robes (which was never in the room) and asked for compensation
text: Booking, check in and food service are good. Though I left a 3 star review because of the check out. It's part of my fault soo as during the stay, one of the room i booked (I book 7 rooms for a family trip) noted they have cotton robe whereas I didnt see it in my room. At check out, 5 room check out earlier and myself and another room (the room with robes) checked out a but later. I was informed that my room the robe are missing and they hotel will charge me for that. I called my mum (checked out earlier) and she said the hotel also just called her telling her the same. Of course I rejected and said there was never robes in my room. THe staff tool 30' to check with their room division and told me no their staff put 2 robes in all rooms. Of course their staff would say so. Then they went on and told me I ddint check the room at check in. I was given a key and send to the room with my luggage, no such things as guiding me through the facilities and provisions etc. FYI, my family business manufactures and produce cotton robes for high end hotels across Vietnam so a hotel robe is nothing attractive to me. I rather use them also because they are usually made with western size, meaning too long too big too heavy for Asian women form. I would use if it's the waffle linen style. After another 30', they asked me to write something saying this and that and released us after I told them we are late for our flight multiple time. It's such a disappointing end at the end of a fun trip.

title: enjoyable!
text: we didn't like Dalat that much but this hotel made our stay there really good. the place is amazing, the rooms are clean and cozy the bed is extremely comfortable. we really enjoyed the pool, the crazy golf course and the yoga lesson the only thing i didn't like is that the staff are trying too hard to sell the hotel's tours which are very expencive.
hotelName: Ana Mandara Villas Dalat Resort & Spa
en_review: we didn't like Dalat that much but this hotel made our stay there really good. the place is amazing, the rooms are clean and cozy the bed is extremely comfortable. we really enjoyed the pool, the crazy golf course and the yoga lesson the only thing i didn't like is that the staff are trying too hard to sell the hotel's tours which are very expencive.

title: Resort with massive potential but falling well short
text: It pains me to write this review, but many of the comments from people rating this place Average and below are very accurate. No question the resort itself it stunning - the facilities, the water location, the villas, although you can see the mainland so not super remote as we expected. That said - several big issues which others have pointed out. I think the biggest issue is lack of leadership. Specifics: - constant upselling from the GEMs. They are trained to be constantly pushing you to go on boat cruises in the evening, boat rides, etc etc - all which cost extra $$. I even had someone I'd never seen before pushing a coral cruise on me at breakfast, plus massage staff at the entrance to breakfast soliciting business. NOT GOOD particularly for an "eco, laid back" resort - food is average but cost is exorbitant. You are locked into a "buffet" almost every night, and at approx 3.5m VND or $150 USD per person for food alone, its incredibly expensive given the range and quality - general chaos at the Activities centre. We had booked a boat for water sports and had to wait almost 45 mins as another family "weren't ready to finish". The general malaise and lack of energy and interest from the Activites staff is v disappointing - more chaos at film night. Kids everywhere, the promised pizza nowhere to be seen, not enough seats, etc. MANAGEMENT - just provide a few free pizzas and reduce the stress of lots of parents trying to order room service in the dark and interrupting the film Bottom line this could be an incredible place. BUT it needs proper management. The GM has no right hand men or women. Great resorts like Amans are defined by their GMs and their lieutenants who ensure everything runs like clock work. This is massively lacking at this resort - per all the comments in these reviews. The GEMs are enthusiastic but young and inexperienced. They need leaders. Urgent attention needed.

title: Holiday
text: Recently stayed at the hotel. It’s beautiful property with really nice big rooms with plunge pools overlooking the beach. Hotel service is excellent. The only thing which can be improved is the limited room service menu.
hotelName: JW Marriott Phu Quoc Emerald Bay Resort & Spa
en_review: Recently stayed at the hotel. It’s beautiful property with really nice big rooms with plunge pools overlooking the beach. Hotel service is excellent. The only thing which can be improved is the limited room service menu.

title: Not that good of a location
text: Although the rooms are not that bad, the overall hotel facilities are poor. The location is pretty remote also. 20 minutes on foot in a muddy road, to get to the nearest beach. Same muddy road the hotel is located on. Not a nice neighbourhood, a bit dirty and smelly. 15 minutes by motorbike to get to the market and the city. In my opinion, with the same money, you can find much better hotels and in more convenient locations.
en_review: Although the rooms are not that bad, the overall hotel facilities are poor. The location is pretty remote also. 20 minutes on foot in a muddy road, to get to the nearest beach. Same muddy road the hotel is located on. Not a nice neighbourhood, a bit dirty and smelly. 15 minutes by motorbike to get to the market and the city. In my opinion, with the same money, you can find much better hotels and in more convenient locations.

title: Calm away from the City
text: Just a night away from the crowd. You take a 30 minutes boat ride and you are already feeling going on week-end. The resort is cute enough for relaxing couple of night. Very nice rooms, large and well equipped. The pool house is more like a big bath but can be very nice for a child. Food is good, cocktail too. Special thanks to the man therapist who did a amazing massage with a good consistence and pressure. I have not had such a quality massage for a while.

Special thanks to the man therapist who did a amazing massage with a good consistence and pressure. I have not had such a quality massage for a while.

title: Family stay at the Mekong Lodge
text: We've just finished a 2 night, 3 day package stay at the Mekong Lodge. We've enjoyed it thoroughly. The food is good, the scheduled activities are informative and fun. We got river front rooms, 2 that easily sleep 3 people each. There is traffic noise from the river throughout the night, and the roosters are loud, but it hasn't bothered us enough to preclude staying here again. For an active family with 3 boys a pool would have been helpful for our "down time". However I booked knowing there was no pool to see how it would work out, and overall it's been great. The cycling in the afternoons is fun and they have bikes to accomadate my 8 year old although the 4 year rode on the back seat of my bike, strapped to my waist. It's a great little place!

title: depressing
text: unfortunately probably the "best" hotel in town. it is ok for one night. very simple. not enough lighting in the room and in the bathroom. overall atmosphere (lobby, corridors, restaurant...) is totally depressing. the staff speaks little or no english. the food is bad, everything soaked in oil. however the rooms are clean and there is hot water.

title: Swandor
text: Осмотрев отель можно сказать, что он подизносился, ощущение, что многое нужно уже заменить! Например пляжные полотенца явно требуют обновления, так как дают с дырами, пятнами, затхлым запахом! Поменял бы сантехнику, появляется чувство брезгливости. Расстроила команда аниматоров, пригласив играть меня с сыном на водный волейболл, аниматор «Беларусик» отказал в игре, сославшись на некие правила отеля, что играть с 11 летним сыном нельзя, это при том, что в игру запустил таких игроков, которым он еще форы даст!!! Детский клуб сына не заинтересовал, так как основной акцент в нем сделан на возрасте до 10 лет. Обидно, разве не за игры и развлечения мы платим деньги при планировании отдыха?

title: Au "chez Carole" on sait qui est le patron!
text: Si vous souhaitez vous replonger dans l époque colonialiste ou l'on s'adresse aux personnels locaux avec poigne et fermeté alors pas de doutes vous êtes au bon endroit ! "Chez Carole" on sait qui est le patron! Une erreur d'un serveur de 10000 dôngs sur le prix d une bouteille de bière et nous avons pu assister à une bonne réprimande ... Nous n'avons pas dormi sur place mais le repas nous a suffi finalement...avec une impression de déjà vu. Benito

Nous n'avons pas dormi sur place mais le repas nous a suffi finalement...avec une impression de déjà vu. Benito

title: Amazing location, kind staff, reasonable prize!
text: We was there at the last weekend and we got amazing time! It has a garden and a front beach with the silent atmosphere. All staffs are kind and friendly, especially Yen, the receptionist lady, patient, helpful. Don't have any restaurant nearby,so if you would like to enjoy the fresh seafood, you may ask the staff there to know where Mr.Duong's house is, cause that is the only one which is provide the seafood in town. Then you could bring the seafood you have bought ( super cheap and fresh) back to the resort' kitchen and asking the chef for cooking with the reasonable extra. Thank you for all and we will comeback for our next holiday!

title: Never stay on TET (Chines New Year Festival)
text: Wir hatten das Pech ausgerechnet während des Neujahrs Festiva in diesem Hotel übernachten zu müssen. Die Zimmer waren ok leider gegen nach hinten. Während der Nacht haben Einheimische unten Schweine geschlachtet. Es war grauenhaft. Heisses Wasser gab es nicht und obwohl Frühstück gebucht hatte es am Buffet einen Salat und Kuchen. Grund: TET Wir werden bestimmt nie mehr hierherkommen auch nicht ausserhalb von TET.

title: Amazing resort, with beautiful and quiet beach and pools + great breakfast
text: We had the beach and pool almost to ourselves. The breakfast is fantastic! The kids club is great, with friendly staff and you can borrow toys for the beach. They also offer free yoga and gym, tennis classes. Only regret is that there is no water fountain and they even don't offer free water during meals. Still very happy with this beautiful place.

title: The Sixth Sense ... Confusion
text: For our wedding anniversary and part of a two week vacation to Vietnam, booked 3 nights at Six Senses. The most expensive accommodation of our trip and with great expectations. We stayed in Hill top villa  about 200 steps above a beautiful bay. The rustic palm thatched villa with a/c. We loved the villa except for the wood boxed Samsung TV and light switches and string wrapped cables ???? The plunge/infinity pool was a perfect cool down after climbing the steps. The room service waiter had to carry food in a back pack through tropical rain and thunderstorms... awesome! Coral reef snorkeling from the beach. Wonderful breakfast buffet, MUST pre-purchase the inclusive package. "Butler" service only a phone call away to drive the golf cart to bars and restaurants. But.... Trip Advisor recently rated Vietnam as the cheapest country in the cheapest region for a room and meal night out package, so why is food Soo expensive here? Wine is as expected throughout SEAsia expensive ... $15 per glass of Chilean wine. The room service and bar meals are about normal Western hotel rates .. expect $20 for a burger/sandwich. The big hit comes at the "premier - dining on the rocks", $80 per person plus drinks for a 3 course meal and frankly I've had better airline food. Big prices for Western food is maybe understandable but again $80 per head plus drinks for a Vietnamese buffet, huh?? given local food and labour costs this must be an astronomical markup! The stay left me with confused responses, great location and villas and fantastic staff but the restaurant prices left me with my jaw on the floor.

We stayed in Hill top villa  about 200 steps above a beautiful bay. The rustic palm thatched villa with a/c. We loved the villa except for the wood boxed Samsung TV and light switches and string wrapped cables ???? The plunge/infinity pool was a perfect cool down after climbing the steps. The room service waiter had to carry food in a back pack through tropical rain and thunderstorms... awesome! Coral reef snorkeling from the beach. Wonderful breakfast buffet, MUST pre-purchase the inclusive package. "Butler" service only a phone call away to drive the golf cart to bars and restaurants. But.... Trip Advisor recently rated Vietnam as the cheapest country in the cheapest region for a room and meal night out package, so why is food Soo expensive here? Wine is as expected throughout SEAsia expensive ... $15 per glass of Chilean wine. The room service and bar meals are about normal Western hotel rates .. expect $20 for a burger/sandwich. The big hit comes at the "premier - dining on the rocks", $80 per person plus drinks for a 3 course meal and frankly I've had better airline food. Big prices for Western food is maybe understandable but again $80 per head plus drinks for a Vietnamese buffet, huh?? given local food and labour costs this must be an astronomical markup! The stay left me with confused responses, great location and villas and fantastic staff but the restaurant prices left me with my jaw on the floor.

title: Do not book transport from this hotel!
text: We stayed in the Hoan My for one night. The rooms were spacious, and reasonably priced, but we ran into problems when we booked a bus to our next stop. We asked to book a bus to Can Tho, and were told we could get a mini bus half way and then we'd be transferred to another bus for the rest of the journey. We payed a little over the odds(150,000 each), but it meant to whole trip was organised and the bus collected us from the hotel so we went for it. The mini bus only brought us to a local station where we transferred to another bus. The next bus brought us to Vinh Long and we were left there on the side of the road. We rang the hotel, and we were told that we had misunderstood and that's what we had paid for in spite of the fact that we had asked to go to Can Tho and were still less that half way there. We were totally misled, otherwise we would have organised our own transport. We had to get motorbikes across town and pay for another bus to get to our destination. The whole experience was very dissappointing, and would prevent me recommending this hotel to anyone.

title: Minste van Vietnam
text: Viel nogal tegen, vrij kleine onhandige kamer. En het heeft niets met een farm te maken. Voor Vietnam erg duur. En er hangt een amerikaanse bom aan de muur, tamelijk onkies wat mij betreft. Het was koud en het restaurant was vergeven van de rook.
en_review: Viel nogal tegen, vrij kleine onhandige kamer. En het heeft niets met een farm te maken. Voor Vietnam erg duur. En er hangt een amerikaanse bom aan de muur, tamelijk onkies wat mij betreft. Het was koud en het restaurant was vergeven van de rook.

title: ハードは最高、ソフトはソーソー
text: 去年からここにはまり3回目の訪問。毎回思うことはタイトルに書いた通りです。１つ１つのビラはとても雰囲気がよくプールも大きく最高です。各レストランの味はそこそこといっかんじでしょうか。あとスパもとても良いです。サービスレベルは英語がベトナム語訛りでよくわからないスタッフが多いのと５つ星てほどのホスピタリティではないですが、、ベトナム人の優しい笑顔と一生懸命さにいつもまぁいいかとなってまたきてしまうんですけど、笑。ご飯がもっと美味しかったらサイコーなのにな

title: Amazing chocolate coffee!
text: Stopped here for a chocolate coffee and it was so good I wish I had the recipe to take home. There is also a small beach you can go down to. The apartments looked new and I would stay here if I went back to Phong Nha for a real Vietnamese experience.
en_review: Stopped here for a chocolate coffee and it was so good I wish I had the recipe to take home. There is also a small beach you can go down to. The apartments looked new and I would stay here if I went back to Phong Nha for a real Vietnamese experience.

title: Has potential
text: The location is great! A very pretty, clean cove. The sea was great for swimming. The accommodation is mostly bamboo huts - so full of bugs, but mosquito nets are provided and the beds are kept very clean. Issues were: no wifi!! Despite there being 'office' wifi. Also if you have a mobifone sim there's no signal. This was abit of a joke as when you're travelling wifi is a must to plan your trip, especially during down time - only so much relaxing can be done. The other life's a beach has wifi so I'm not really sure what this one is thinking? The food is awful. Just vile and you'll pay about $6 for it - bland and tasteless. We've stayed in much more remote locations than this and had delicious food. So it's not really an issue of location, also they're only around 20 mins from a main city so not that remote. The music! Urgh I die. The most cringe charts pop. Not cool. Really awful. I expected so much more. The Vietnamese staff are amazing. So helpful. The western staff - a joke. I caught one shouting in the Vietnamese staff's face because he didn't agree with the ordering system!? They're lazy and useless. They had 0 charisma and their role was utterly pointless.

title: terrible for digital nomads
text: I stayed in this place about 2 years ago because I needed to stay near family in Long Khanh. Compared to other homestays and hotels in and around the area, this is the worst place I stayed in. I couldn't get ANY work done because the WiFi speed (I actually tested it) was NIL (zero)! Unbelievable. I tested the WiFi speed BEFORE I checked in and it was blazing fast. However, once you are a paying customer, they pull a bait-and-switch and your room's WiFi speed crawls down to at or near zero. I couldn't even browse a simple web page without waiting forever to load it, much less actually get my work done (I teach online via Skype). The only reason I got ANY work done was that I had 4G service on my smartphone and I used the hotspot feature for my laptop. To top it all off, the reason for the 1 star review (I would give NEGATIVE stars if I could) was the lady owner's "don't give a sh*t" attitude. Both my Vietnamese wife and I talked to her about this. She didn't care. Unfortunately, this is very typical of Vietnam. If you don't like the food, service, or stay, then tough. You still have pay in full. But other hotels and homestays in the area were much better than this place. At least in other places the WiFi is fairly strong and reliable so I had no reason to complain. The fact that I actually remember what a horrible this place was 2 years after the fact should tell you something. STAY AWAY!

title: Dịch vụ cần được cải thiện
text: Phòng là mới và spacy và thoải mái. Nhân viên cần được đào tạo nhiều hơn nữa. Có rất nhiều người trong số họ nhưng không nhiều người biết phải làm gì. Họ thậm chí còn không biết tôi đã sử dụng dịch vụ giặt ủi và cần tính phí cho tôi khi kiểm tra nếu tôi không nói với họ. Thực phẩm cần phải được cải thiện. Đầu bếp không biết nấu ăn.

title: Peaceful, relaxing hotel
text: My hubby and I stayed here for 4 days after a hectic 2 week tour of Vietnam. We were in desperate need of a relaxing place to rejuvenate and we found it here. Attentive staff, only to willing to help. We rode the hotel push bikes around the local streets and found a great place to get our clothes washed. This lovely lady charged us 20,000 dong for 5kgs of clothes. We gave her 30,000 dong for her same day service, we were more than happy. The hotel has a free shuttle bus into Hue which is fantastic. Some lovely little places to eat and get a drink. Probably needs a little updating but on the whole a fantastic place to stay. Oh yeah...they have happy hour everyday at the pool bar, 2 for the price of one...bargain.

Oh yeah...they have happy hour everyday at the pool bar, 2 for the price of one...bargain.

title: Không phải người đẹp !!!
text: Chúng tôi đã đặt trước khi đặt phòng nhưng khi chúng tôi đến khách sạn, họ nói với chúng tôi rằng không thể có phòng nếu chúng tôi không trả 700000 đồng và yêu cầu chúng tôi hủy đặt phòng khi đặt phòng! (Khi đặt vé là 200000)

title: So comfy!
text: I had a lovely stay here. Great value for money. The private rooms are great. Such comfortable and warm beds. Loved the whole vibe to the place. Very relaxing. Great restaurant and friendly staff. All in all I highly recommend this place. Definitely worth a try!

title: Letto durissimo
text: Abbiamo trascorso una notte in questo hotel, letto duro sembrava di dormire su un tavolato di legno comunque molto pulito camera essenziale con bagno nella norma calcolando la zona......wi fi buono a volte solo nella hall.l' hotel non dispone di ristorante ne per la colazione ne per la cena.

title: Выбор комнаты
text: Читала, тут о шумных номерах в корпусе А. Поэтому при заезде, попросила, нас поселить в "тихий номер". При выдаче ключей сотрудник отеля, с гордостью нам сообщила, что нас поселили в тихом корпусе " В", где они селят всех постояльцев с детьми. Я была очень рада. В итоге я не понимаю, это у сотрудников отеля такое чувство юмора ? В номере "китайская дискотека " которая начинается где-то в 8-30 и заканчивается за полночь. Музыка идёт из бара у бассейна соседнего отеля, который находится прямо под моим оком. Если они так селят все семьи с детьми специально, то ... не знаю , как это откомментировать . Попробую попросить поменять номер, так как думаю на противоположную сторону могут быть по тише;-( и так заключение корпус В нечетная сторона = китайская дискотека (

title: How beautiful resort ! Nice Happy Hour!
text: Just went here on my last day because it quiet far from the city. But I wish i was there earlier. How amazing resort, which just like on the movie. The cleanest Beach in Phu Quoc for sure. Happy Hours at Chemistry Bar for Buy 1 get 1 free from the list of cocktails from 5pm . Awesome service if i have to compare with Novotel Phu Quoc, where the Pool service is poor. Special thanks Mr Loc for gave us best service ever ,always smile and asking to refill peanut even it for free. Had to pay 500.000 viet nam /each for enter voucher. But can use this voucher like internal money with the same value.
hotelName: JW Marriott Phu Quoc Emerald Bay Resort & Spa

Happy Hours at Chemistry Bar for Buy 1 get 1 free from the list of cocktails from 5pm . Awesome service if i have to compare with Novotel Phu Quoc, where the Pool service is poor. Special thanks Mr Loc for gave us best service ever ,always smile and asking to refill peanut even it for free. Had to pay 500.000 viet nam /each for enter voucher. But can use this voucher like internal money with the same value.

title: Donde esta?
text: Queríamos ir a dormir aquí para contratar un tour por la zona desmilitarizada, llegamos a la calle exacta, al número exacto... Y allí no había nada. Nos cansamos de preguntar, la gente nos mandaba por caminos de tierra, y ni una sola indicación ni señal. Estuvimos casi una hora y media dando más vueltas que un tonto, y finalmente decidimos parar en otro pueblo. Después de ver el comentario de un cliente en tripadvisor, me alegro de no haber dormido allí...

title: Teleurstelling
text: Na Sa Pa en Mai Chau wilden we oom graag in dit gebied verblijven. Het is net open En dat merk je. Nog geen menukaart of keuze in het restaurant bijvoorbeeld. Bij aankomst meteen een trekking gedaan met een locale jongen. Erg leuk! Bij terugkomst ging het mis. Er waren inmiddels groepen uit Hanoi geaariveerd. Hele harde muziek bij het zwembad. Na half uur gevraagd of muziek uit mocht. Wij gingen vroeg eten om te voorkomen dat we samen met heb zouden eten. Dat ging mis helaas. Ze kwamen binnen muziekboxen op tafel en hard aan. Wij zijn naar onze kamer gegaan. Helaas besloot de jeugd buiten te gaan eten met muziek en uiteindelijk met luide karaoke. Het management was er niet tegen op gewassen en vond het ook kunnen tot negen uur s avonds. Uiteindelijk heeft het tot 23.00’uur geduuurd maar wij lagen al op bed. Geen eco of natuur gevoel. Bedrijf moet kiezen tussen jeugd en luide muziek of eco. Maar niet samen. Ma al onze andere ervaringen was dit echt teleurstellend. Wij zijn vervroegd vertrokken.
